Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess the effects of this combination and compare its performance relative to monotherapies on pain score reduction and opioid-sparing effect by leveraging evidence from acute pain setting using a model-based meta-analysis (MBMA).

Method_Outcome.evidence: Pain score reduction and opioid-sparing effect (OSE) were selected as the measures of efficacy.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 11 RCTs encompassing 1396 patients were included.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The analysis revealed a statistically significant interaction coefficient, suggesting a reduction of 32% in opioid use with the combination versus acetaminophen monotherapy.
